neighbors.name: Kenneth Nathaniel Ritchie
neighbors.claims: Kenneth Ritchie has been involved in multiple real estate transactions, with at least 19 property purchases and 11 sales recorded under his name [RealtyHop](https://www.realtyhop.com/property-records/search/kenneth-ritchie). Public records list Ritchie’s current address on Biddy Road in rural Rome, GA, suggesting he resides near his Floyd County parcels [National Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/r/kenneth-ritchie/ga/). No references to him speaking in local meetings or taking public positions were found in news or civic records as of 2026 [National Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/r/kenneth-ritchie/ga/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with a straightforward, business-like conversation emphasizing how the project can protect or enhance land value. Highlight any economic benefits and listen to his input, given his experience with property dealings.

neighbors.name: Margaret Foy
neighbors.claims: Margaret Foy is identified as a Floyd County landowner (parcel M15008), but she maintains a very low public profile with no evident online or civic presence [TruePeopleSearch](https://truepeoplesearch.net/people/margaret-foy). Searches of local news and public records yielded no mention of Foy taking any stance or role in community development matters [Yahoo News](https://www.yahoo.com/now/stories-of-the-south-letter-from-rome-120000001.html).
neighbors.influence_justification: Private citizen; no known public roles

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a personal, neighborly approach to introduce the project. It may help to have a familiar local figure or mutual acquaintance start the conversation and patiently address any questions or comfort concerns she might have.

overview_summary: Both profiled neighbors have no documented stance on development (0 support, 0 oppose, 2 unknown stances). Neither appears to hold any public office or influence; there are no high-influence neighbors identified in this group.
